Carsebridge 33 Year Old Single Barrel Cask Strength
‚†Ä
Single Grain Scotch Whisky
‚†Ä
90.8 Proof / 45.4% ABV
‚†Ä
Distilled Dec 1982 / Bottled Nov 2016
‚†Ä
Cask No. 11520 / 1 of 233 Bottles
‚†Ä
This 33 year old single barrel cask strength release from Carsebridge was distilled only a year before the distillery was closed and dismantled. Matured in a refill sherry hogshead, it was produced by @dlaingwhisky, and released under their Old Particular series for @klwines.
‚†Ä
The Carsebridge Distillery was built in 1799 in the town of Alloa, Clackmannshire County. Clackmannan, also located within the boundaries of Clackmannshire, was the cradle of brewing and distilling in Scotland during the late eighteenth century. Carsebridge began as a pot still malt whisky distillery, but switched to patent stills and grain whisky production in 1860.
‚†Ä
In 1966 the distillery was transferred to Scottish Grain Distillers (S.G.D.), at which time it was one of the biggest grain distilleries in Scotland, employing 300 people, a 40 man fire brigade, three Coffey stills along with a large dark-grains plant.
‚†Ä
In 1983 the distillery was closed and dismantled, and is now the site of Diageo‚Äôs Spirit Supply, Scotland division, which is responsible for all the company‚Äôs spirits production. The site also houses the company‚Äôs principal cooperage and ‚Äòbodega‚Äô ‚Äì the latter for seasoning casks with sherry or other wines. ‚Äì Whiskypedia
‚†Ä
Carsebridge has only ever been bottled as a single grain with high age statements by independent bottlers in recent years, though as a result of its closure in 1983, stocks are now running low. @scotchwhiskycom / ScotchWhisky.com
‚†Ä
üéâ @tstoff

Yellowstone 2016 Limited Edition
‚†Ä
Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey
‚†Ä
101 Proof / 50.5% ABV
‚†Ä
Approximately 7,000 Bottles Produced
‚†Ä
Bottles 2300 & 2314
‚†Ä
92 Points ‚Äì Whiskey Advocate
‚†Ä
Limestone Branch Distillery‚Äôs 2016 release of Yellowstone‚Äôs Limited Edition Kentucky Straight Bourbon first hit shelves in October of 2016. The 2016 version combined two extra-aged rye mashed bourbons (a 12-year old and a 7-year old), which were hand-selected and before being finished for several months in new toasted wine barrels.
‚†Ä
The company used 28 new wine barrels with varying levels of toast, resulting in a different bourbon compared to the 2015 LE. According to Steve Beam, president and distiller of @limestonebranch Distillery, ‚Äò‚Ä¶last year‚Äôs edition was more about big, bold flavors achieved through char and age, this year‚Äôs is softer with a subtle complexity.‚Äô Each of the bottles is hand numbered and features Steve Beam‚Äôs signature. ‚Äì @kentuckybourbontrail / KYBourbonTrail.com
‚†Ä
Steve Beam and his brother Paul Beam founded Limestone Branch Distillery with the intention of crafting only the finest whiskey and the dream of restoring the Yellowstone brand to its former glory. In the spring of 2015, over a century after their great-grandfather, Minor Case Beam, sold his distillery to Yellowstone, their dream came true. To celebrate this family reunion of sorts, they produced Yellowstone Select. With a history of distilling on both sides of their family ‚Äì Beam and Dant ‚Äì the brothers are seventh-generation distillers. ‚Äì LimeStoneBranch.com
‚†Ä
üí™üèª @tstoff

Talisker 6 Year Old Single Cask 2009 ‚Äì Old Malt Cask
‚†Ä
Single Malt Scotch Whisky
‚†Ä
100 Proof / 50% ABV
‚†Ä
Distilled Nov 2009 / Bottled Oct 2016
‚†Ä
Cask No. 12934
‚†Ä
1 of 361 Bottles
‚†Ä
An independent bottling of single malt Scotch whisky from the Talisker distillery on the Isle of Skye, aged in a single refill sherry hogshead for 6 years.
‚†Ä
A unique characteristic of Talisker is the peppery, even chili-peppery ‚Äòcatch‚Äô as you swallow. Nobody knows where it comes from.
‚†Ä
Talisker is one of only a handful of malts bottled as singles in the early twentieth century. Until it was selected as a Classic Malt in 1988 it was bottled as 8 years, and thereafter at 10 years. An oddity of the make is that it is traditionally bottled at slightly higher than standard strength. Very few independent bottlings have been done, since the malt is extensively used in the Johnnie Walker blends. ‚Äì Whiskypedia
‚†Ä
‚è≤ @tstoff

It's been a week. I need 2-3 bourbon lovers to come over tonight and finish all five of these...kidding, maybe 4 of you can come.
‚†Ä
ü§∑üèº‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è @tstoff ‚†Ä
‚†Ä

The Big Smoke 60
‚†Ä
Blended Malt Scotch Whisky
‚†Ä
120 Proof / 60% ABV
‚†Ä
Gold ‚Äì 2013 International Wine & Spirits Competition (IWSC)
‚†Ä
92 Points ‚Äì Jim Murray‚Äôs Whisky Bible
‚†Ä
90 Points ‚Äì Whisky Advocate
‚†Ä
Big Smoke 60 is a blended whisky produced by Duncan Taylor Scotch Whisky Ltd, who are one of Scotland‚Äôs largest independent bottling companies. There are two whiskies in the range ‚Äì the Big Smoke 40 and the 60 ‚Äì and both are blended in small batches. These are the same whiskies, but are bottled at different strengths (40% and 60% ABV respectively). Big Smoke contains a large percentage of young blended smoky single malts from the isle of Islay. ‚Äì WhiskyForEveryone.blogspot.com
‚†Ä
Unlike its cousin the Big Smoke 40, which is partial to a couple of cigarettes after school before heading home to hide the fact unsuccessfully  from its parents, the Big Smoke 60 is an unapologetic 60 a day chain-smoking bruiser. Although on the surface the whisky may be all about smoke, scratch a little deeper, and you‚Äôll find that it has other, hidden dimensions that are at odds with its outward appearance. Imagine Lemmy from Motorhead simultaneously smoking a Cuban cigar, reading a Jane Austen novel, and making a fresh fruit salad, and there you have the Big Smoke 60.
‚†Ä
Like the Big Smoke 40, the 60 carries no age statement, nor is there any indication of which whiskies go into making it. None of that matters, because for drinkers who like the intensity of the big-hitting south coast Islay distilleries, this is one hell of a ride, full of the iodine and peat reek of the Laphroaigs and Ardbegs, but displaying the fruit and lightness of touch of some of the distilleries from the north and west of Islay.
‚†Ä
In the Big Smoke 60 Duncan Taylor has produced a whisky that is less a love letter to the god of hellfire and smoke, and more an ode to Islay as a whole, showing that the island has plenty more to offer than just peat. ‚Äì 1001 Whiskies You Must Taste Before You Die
‚†Ä
ü§ò @tstoff

WhistlePig FarmStock ‚Äì Crop 001
‚†Ä
Rye Whiskey
‚†Ä
86 Proof / 43% ABV
‚†Ä
2017 is proving to be a memorable year for @whistlepigwhiskey. After countless hours of hard work, the Vermont based distillery achieved a goal set on day one by owner Raj Bhakta and Master Distiller Dave Pickerell: creating a true farm-to-bottle whiskey. The fact that they may well be the only American distillery to achieve this feat, is even more impressive when you consider that the company launched in 2011 and their distillery wasn‚Äôt operational until October of 2015.
‚†Ä
Crop 001‚Äôs mashbill is comprised of 3 components: 20% is a 1 year old rye produced by WhistlePig‚Äôs Distillery and aged in oak grown on the WhistlePig farm, 49% is a 5 year old rye from Alberta Distillers (also aged in WhistlePig's oak), with the remaining 31% being a 12 year old rye from MGP.
‚†Ä
However, the 1 year old rye in Crop 001‚Äôs mashbill is what the Vermont team is most excited about. The rye is grown on their farm, distilled onsite, and aged in oak grown on their farm, before being cut with water drawn from their own well.
‚†Ä
Recently introduced to limited markets, including NYC, San Francisco, LA, and Chicago, the distillery plans on releasing the remaining stock of Crop 001 in the coming months. New editions of FarmStock will be released in the coming years, beginning with Crop 002. Future batches will feature larger percentages of the distillery‚Äôs whiskey, with the goal to eventually produce a rye comprised of 100% WhistlePig distillate.
‚†Ä
Located in a 150-year-old renovated dairy barn, WhistlePig‚Äôs Distillery, and Crop 001, is the culmination of 5 years of dedication to their craft. The Farm is home to pigs, sheep, goats, and horses. Oats, barley, alfalfa, honey, maple syrup, and an array of vegetables are also grown on the farm. Embracing more than 500 acres, more than 30 people are working around the clock at any given time. ‚Äì WhistlePigWhiskey.com
‚†Ä
For more info on FarmStock and other WhistlePig news, check out @whistlepigwhiskey ‚†Ä
üì∑ @mesropj

Oban Little Bay
‚†Ä
Single Malt Scotch Whisky
‚†Ä
86 Proof / 43% ABV
‚†Ä
96 Points ‚Äì 2016 Ultimate Spirits Challenge
‚†Ä
Double Gold Medal ‚Äì 2016 San Francisco World Spirits Competition (SWSC)
‚†Ä
Previously part of their travel retail offering, Oban's Little Bay has graduated to their core range. Master Blenders Dr. Matthew Crow and Dr. Craig Wilson use whisky matured in refill American oak hogsheads, European oak Sherry casks and refill casks with new ends for this expression before allowing the resultant single malt whisky to marry in small oak casks. ‚Äì MasterOfMalt.com
‚†Ä
Oban Little Bay is married in the smallest casks available at the distillery; 200-litre ex-bourbon barrels. This has resulted in a rich whisky with notes of stone fruit, spice and honey. The whisky is so named because Oban translates as 'little bay' from Gaelic and it has been created by two of Diageo's Master Blenders.
‚†Ä
Oban is located on the west coast of Scotland and is named after the town of the same name.  Oban is the main hub for ferries traveling to the Hebridean islands and the town has grown up around the distillery, which was founded in 1794 by Hugh and John Stevenson.  The buildings were originally a brewery and the distillery is one of just a few remaining in Scotland that were founded in the 18th century.  It is currently owned by Diageo and the popular 14 years old expression is one of the six whiskies in their Classic Malts series.  It is one of the smallest distilleries in Diageo's Scotch portfolio with an annual production capacity of 870,000 liters. ‚Äì WhiskyForEveryone.blogspot.com
‚†Ä

New books, old whisky.
‚†Ä
Which should I open tonight?
‚†Ä

Corti Brothers Exquisite Whiskey Reserve
‚†Ä
Bourbon Whiskey
‚†Ä
90.5 Proof / 45.25% ABV
‚†Ä
Corti Brothers Exquisite Whiskey Reserve is a limited release bourbon which has been double wooded. It spent the first part of its life in freshly charred white oak barrels, before being transferred for about 26 months to Mission barrels which have held and aged Mission del Sol wine since 1972. ‚†Ä
‚†Ä
The Reserve release contains whiskey that has spent the longest time in Mission barrels, compared to previous Corti Brothers batches. ‚†Ä
‚†Ä
Sadly, the Reserve release contains the very last drops of their whiskey produced using the influence of the Mission del Sol barrels. - CortiBrothers.com
‚†Ä
üì∏ @mesropj
